bug.short_desc: [1.8][compiler] Investigate status of disabled generics tests

long_desc.thetext:
There are a few dozens of tests in GTT that are disabled for 1.8. This ticket is to investigate the status of those and enable them by possibly remastering the tests and/or fixing the compiler.
We should also check whether GRT* have similarly disabled tests.

As a first step, enabled 20+ tests in GTT with adjusted expectations here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=f0ad677ecfc3fb2aae0264f20715771e958071e0.
New expected output matches 1.7- modes and javac 8u20.

Another batch of changes cleaning up GRT, GRT1_7, GRT1_8 are here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=c87a79156f1dc9a83ba58914de459221d3943f61.
I have a few left in GTT that I'll take a look at now. So far no issues discovered.

Final batch of clean up from my side for this bug got released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=1de8e2f6bc728cee690d70795383b83c1f0d652a
The following 8 tests still need closer study so I left them disabled:
GTT.test0168 GTT.test1076 GTT.test1148 GTT.test0742 GTT.test1015 GTT.test1281 GTT.test1291 GTT.test1323
Assigning to you Stephan with the target milestone removed out of M4.
Don't let it slip entirely -> back into 4.5 on general terms.
